resource.chars:
drawn originally looking a little to one side of us, may 
be made to look at us by applying other features in 
a suitable position. But although a change of 20
or perhaps 30 degrees may be effected, it is not to be 
supposed that a turn of 90 degrees can be produced.
It would be absurd to imagine that an eye drawn in 
profile could be made to look full upon us, or that an 
eye looking nearly at us could be made to appear in profile.
If an attempt be made to carry the experiment beyond 
reasonable limits, so that the perspective form of the eyes is 
glaringly ill-suited to that of the rest of the face, the effect 
is impaired by such obvious discordance, but is not al-
together lost; for though some persons much accustomed 
to drawing the human eye, who are in the habit of at-
tending minutely to the shape of the lids from overrating
